title: In Brazil, President Bolsonaro meets with Lula's team
description: After fears that Jair Bolsonaro would try to fight his election defeat, the visit was described as 'positive'. But although the president has vowed to respect the constitution, he has not acknowledged Lula's win or congratulated him. Lula will take office on January 1.

title: Manhattan Judge will appoint a monitor for Trump's company in fraud case
description: A judge said Thursday that he wants "to ensure there is no further fraud" at the former president's company, restricting its ability to freely make deals, sell assets and change its corporate structure.

title: Paul Pelosi's Canadian attacker shouldn't have reentered the US
description: The Canadian man accused of attacking the Speaker's husband in their San Francisco house had overstayed his authorized entry more than two decades ago. Paul Pelosi has left the hospital on Thursday.

title: 'Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris': A housekeeper's fairy tale
description: The sweet, if not dull, adaptation of a Paul Gallico novel follows a modest woman who realizes her dream of buying a Christian Dior dress in post-war Paris.

title: Time to 'welcome' Finland and Sweden into NATO, says Stoltenberg during Turkey visit
description: The NATO chief said Sweden and Finland have delivered on the demands Turkey set for their accession into the international organization.

title: Why Taiwan's electronic chip industry is caught up in US-China tensions
description: Accustomed to doing business behind the scenes, Taiwan's leading chip manufacturers are finding themselves at the center of a technology war between the United States and China.

title: German businesses question their relationship with China
description: With Chancellor Olaf Scholz in China on Friday for a controversial visit, German industry is divided on what to do with Beijing.

title: Norway threatens to impose 40% tax on salmon producers
description: The center-left government wants to impose a 40% tax on profits from aquaculture starting from January 1, 2023. The government says that producers are profiting from natural resources which belong to all Norwegians.

title: Israeli PM Lapid concedes defeat, congratulates Netanyahu on Israel election 'victory'
description: Former Prime Minister Benjain Netanyahu and his right-wing allies secured a majority of seats in parliament following Israel's elections, according to the country's electoral commission.

title: Bad timing? Germany's Scholz heads to China amid debate over future relations
description: The German chancellor said the way his country deals with China 'must change,' amid a wave of criticism from German politicians in the run-up to his trip.

title: Assemblée Nationale suspends session over uproar after 'back to Africa' outburst from far-right MP
description: Debate was suspended after an MP from the far-right Rassemblement National made the remark. 'Racism has no place in our democracy,' responded Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne.

title: French government announces a €400 million package for deteriorating pediatric services
description: Faced with staff shortages and insufficient resources, hospitals had to transfer at least 34 children from the Parisian region.

title: America's democracy is under threat
description: Donald Trump's anti-democratic fever has not subsided since his defeat in 2020. His rhetoric is fed by the cowardness of Republican leaders, and now poses a real threat to the November 8 midterm elections.

title: Move it, move it? Madagascar wants to make the film's (non-native) animals a tourist attraction
description: While the island has unique biodiversity, the Malagasy president wants to introduce giraffes, elephants and zebras to attract tourists.

title: US Democrats are entangled in the immigration trap
description: As the midterms approach, President Biden's party cannot claim any improvement on migration, a failure playing into the hands of the Republicans.

title: French government splits over interior minister's 'ecoterrorism' claim
description: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin seemed to backtrack on his comment on Wednesday before Parliament, but then repeated it on television on Thursday morning.

title: 2022 midterms: Biden calls for defending democracy, while voters are more concerned with the economy
description: The president reminded the electorate that 'over 300' candidates refuse to say they will accept the outcome.

title: US Fed raises rates with no relief in sight
description: The chair of the US central bank dashed the markets' hopes for a 'U-turn' in monetary policy.

title: UK makes biggest interest rate hike in decades
description: The Bank of England announced that the interest rate would rise to 3% and warns that the country faces its longest-ever recession.

title: Pakistan's ex-PM wounded in gun attack
description: Imran Khan was shot in the foot at a political rally on November 3, but he is in a stable condition, an aide said.

title: Brigitte Giraud wins the Goncourt Prize for 'Vivre vite'
description: With her poignant book on the death of her partner Claude in 1999, the writer from Lyon becomes the 13th woman to receive France's top literary prize.

title: Trump's shadow looms over Republican midterms campaign
description: For the November 8 elections, the former president is lending his support to the most extremist candidates. He is still popular among Republican voters – who are encouraging him to consider another run for president in 2024.

title: 'Amsterdam': A crazy 1930s game of spies and Nazis
description: David O. Russell delivers a big, zany, star-studded production, alternately enjoyable and absurd.

title: New UN report says climate adaptation has been 'too little, too slow'
description: The United Nations Environment Program is calling for a massive expansion of efforts to limit the impacts of climate change on societies and ecosystems.

title: Elon Musk's Twitter takeover raises questions over future moderation rules
description: The all-powerful new boss has announced that freedom of expression will be a priority on the platform. His first measures took aim directly at the moderation teams.

title: 2022 US midterms: 'I am worried about Republican candidates claiming fraud based on no real evidence'
description: Bill Kristol, a former member of the Bush and Reagan administrations, shares his alarm about his party's evolution under the influence of Donald Trump.

title: To combat inflation, Greek government forces supermarkets to reduce prices on basic products
description: Faced with the rising cost of living, the government passed a law requiring stores to have at least one product in each food category at a lowered price.

title: Aileen Getty: Billionaire proud to finance environmental activists' dramatic actions
description: The granddaughter of oil tycoon J. Paul Getty is publicly showing her support for the attention-grabbing protests carried out by Just Stop Oil activists in museums.

title: France pays national tribute to artist Pierre Soulages at the Louvre
description: French Presiden Emmanuel Macron held a ceremony in honor of artist famous for painting with the color black, who died on October 26 at the age of 102.

title: New North Korean missile launches cause false alarm in Japan
description: Pyongyang launched three new projectiles toward the Sea of Japan on Thursday, a day after an unprecedented salvo of fire that has raised tensions in the region to new heights.

title: One third of World Heritage glaciers will be gone by 2050, warns UNESCO
description: From Yellowstone and Yosemite in the United States to Mount Kilimanjaro and Mount Kenya in Africa and Mont-Perdu in the Pyrénées, many iconic glaciers in UNESCO-listed sites are doomed.

title: 'Saturn Bowling:' a deep-dive into the darkness of mankind
description: Director Patricia Mazuy explores where humanity's impulse for murder originates in this tragedy that sees two brothers torn apart over the image of their dead father.

title: Leslie Moonves, CBS to pay $30.5 million in case tied sexual assault allegations
description: CBS and its former president reached an agreement with the New York attorney general's office, which says the network's executives conspired with a Los Angeles police captain to conceal sexual assault allegations against Mr. Moonves.

title: From Murdoch to Macron: Frédéric Michel, the Elysée's new head of PR
description: The French president's new 'special communications advisor' is familiar with British and Italian politics – and with the Murdoch media empire, for which he lobbied.

title: North Korea continues missile barrage
description: North Korea continued its barrage of weapons tests on Thursday, firing at least three missiles including a suspected intercontinental ballistic missile that forced the Japanese government to issue evacuation alerts and temporarily halt trains.

title: Bolsonaro calls on supporters to 'unblock' roads, encourages 'legitimate' protest
description: Supporters of the far-right leader, unwilling to accept the results of Mr. Bolsonaro's Sunday election defeat, have erected hundreds of roadblocks causing disruptions nationwide.

title: Colombian President Petro visits Venezuela as both countries seek to normalize relations
description: The meeting on Tuesday, November 2, between Mr. Petro and his Venezuelan counterpart, President Nicolas Maduro, indicates the restoration of diplomatic relations between the two countries that have been broken since 2019.
